generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient reports daily pain in the lower back and bilateral legs. The pain has been persistent and ongoing, with no significant improvement despite use of supportive measures such as braces and over-the-counter pain relief. The patient describes a history of a detached disc on one side and a torn disc on the other side of the lumbar spine. They currently use braces for ambulation, particularly during activities such as walking in hilly terrain. The patient is retired and not currently working. They express interest in physical therapy as a treatment option and are open to further interventions, including an MRI and potential epidural injection. The patient has not received any new medications from the provider during this visit. They previously used Tylenol and warm baths for symptom management. The patient is concerned about the need for an MRI and the timeline for treatment approval. They are awaiting approval for an injection, which the provider explained may involve sedation and temporary incapacitation. The patient is scheduled to return in October for follow-up. The patient also mentions a prior visit where they were advised to undergo an MRI, which was not completed at that time. The provider emphasized the importance of timely check-ins and real-time updates during visits.

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Order MRI of the lumbar spine to evaluate current disc pathology and assess for progression or new findings.
Initiate physical therapy for lumbar stabilization and pain management.
Consider epidural steroid injection for pain relief, pending insurance approval.
Prescribe a trial of non-opioid analgesia (e.g., tramadol or gabapentin) if pain persists despite conservative measures.
Educate patient on proper use of braces during ambulation and activity modification.
Schedule follow-up appointment in October for review of MRI results and treatment plan adjustment.
Coordinate with insurance for approval of injection and imaging studies.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section, provide everything in a list.
